ai.summary: An easy 2.4 km hike in the UK along a short rural route named Helston BR 31. The walk is flat and beginner-friendly, suitable for families and casual walkers seeking a quick countryside experience with occasional scenery along fields and hedgerows.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily flat, well-surfaced paths (tarmac or compact gravel) with some grass verges. Expect occasional mud after rain and clear waymarkers. The route is mostly open countryside with occasional shade.
ai.safety_notes: This is a short, easy walk, but always follow general outdoor safety. Wear sturdy footwear and check the weather beforehand. Stay on the paths, be mindful of any road crossings, and close gates behind you. Keep dogs under control and on a leash if required. Bring water, a charged phone, and a small map or offline navigation. If visibility is poor, adjust pace and stay with a companion.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers) and a waterproof jacket
Map or offline GPS (or a charged smartphone)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; suitable year-round with proper gear and weather considerations.
